resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kiszk opened a new pull request #11686:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11686


   This PR fixes the following test failures
   
   ```
   FAILED pyarrow/tests/test_array.py::test_array_from_numpy_unicode - UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-32-le' codec can't decode bytes in position 0-3: code point not in range(0x110000)
   FAILED pyarrow/tests/test_array.py::test_array_from_strided - UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-32-le' codec can't decode bytes in position 0-3: code point not in range(0x110000)
   FAILED pyarrow/tests/test_array.py::test_array_from_numpy_str_utf8 - UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-32-le' codec can't decode bytes in position 0-3: code point not in range(0x110000)
   ```


--

kiszk commented on a change in pull request #11687:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11687#discussion_r748071213



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/numpy_to_arrow.cc
##########
@@ -662,7 +663,11 @@ Status NumPyConverter::Visit(const StringType& type) {
   char numpy_byteorder = dtype_->byteorder;
 
   // For Python C API, -1 is little-endian, 1 is big-endian
+#if ARROW_LITTLE_ENDIAN

Review comment:
       `byteorder` has `|` (native) regarding built-in type. Thus, we use `ARROW_LITTLE_ENDIAN` to handle `|`.




-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

kiszk commented on a change in pull request #11687:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11687#discussion_r748071213



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/numpy_to_arrow.cc
##########
@@ -662,7 +663,11 @@ Status NumPyConverter::Visit(const StringType& type) {
   char numpy_byteorder = dtype_->byteorder;
 
   // For Python C API, -1 is little-endian, 1 is big-endian
+#if ARROW_LITTLE_ENDIAN

Review comment:
       `byteorder` has [`|` (native)](https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/generated/numpy.dtype.byteorder.html) regarding built-in type. Thus, we use `ARROW_LITTLE_ENDIAN` to handle `|`.




-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

wesm commented on a change in pull request #11687:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11687#discussion_r748912798



##########
File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/numpy_to_arrow.cc
##########
@@ -662,7 +663,11 @@ Status NumPyConverter::Visit(const StringType& type) {
   char numpy_byteorder = dtype_->byteorder;
 
   // For Python C API, -1 is little-endian, 1 is big-endian
+#if ARROW_LITTLE_ENDIAN

Review comment:
       Could you add a comment here to this effect (that both `|` and `<` yield little-endian in the first case and `|` and `>` yield big-endian in the second case)?




--

ursabot commented on pull request #11687:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11687#issuecomment-971491344


   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = 35cc9d1409ed4bab07a40af704a13a6b2011f691 and contender = c6eb07462ceaf99601eb22d2dc13a837d6ea631b. c6eb07462ceaf99601eb22d2dc13a837d6ea631b is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.
   Conbench compare runs links:
   [Scheduled] [ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/da6bfe1d83a54bde9e431f7daf3ae004...3be91e33dec74276b5e78105cbc4afca/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-i9-9960x](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/10d3ef86158e44c19851a29f8e3a57fe...e75aa4d7f75e44be8115bbb9ea3187b8/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-thinkcentre-m75q](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/992bc3c783754e5e8ef2fae595ef92a1...88301980e1f24475b83759216503dd77/)
   Supported benchmarks:
   ursa-i9-9960x: langs = Python, R, JavaScript
   ursa-thinkcentre-m75q: langs = C++, Java
   ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2: cloud = True
   


--

fields.summary: [Python] Current endian decision for numpy does not work for built-in data type.
